snippet: President Obama’s budget blueprint, to be laid out Monday, is an election-year wager that higher taxes on the rich and spending on popular programs will outweigh deficit concerns.
abstract: Pres Obama will lay out a budget blueprint that amounts to an election-year wager that higher taxes on the rich and more spending on popular programs like infrastructure and manufacturing will trump public concerns with the deficit; proposal contrasts with deficit-cutting promises of the 2011 budget rollout; figures indicate that the White House foresees a slightly higher deficit in the current fiscal year than the $1.3 trillion deficit of the 2011 fiscal year, even after the budget battles that dominated Washington in 2011.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s budget blueprint, to be laid out Monday, is an election-year wager that higher taxes on the rich and spending on popular programs will outweigh deficit concerns.

headline.seo: Obama Budget Lessens Focus on Deficit
headline.main: Obama Budget Bets Other Concerns Will Trump the Deficit
headline.print_headline: Obama Budget Lessens Focus On the Deficit
